About

I enjoy working for people, projects, and companies that aim to create a positive social impact. Iâ€™m a jack of all trades in the realm of marketing and enthusiastic about hands-on fast-paced work.

I am the Founder & Executive Director of TechTogether, a nonprofit that works to increase the access, exposure, and inclusion of gender-marginalized students in the interdisciplinary fields of technology. My work for TechTogether has been featured in the New York Times, Boston Globe, Boston Herald, and Washington Post.

Previously, I was the Founder & CEO of The Bit, an online learning platform that pairs you with a partner to complete online coding courses. I was also formerly a Marketing Associate at a physical security startup, Armored Things.

I like to spend my free time creating fun animations for TechTogether, identifying the plants in my neighborhood, reading books, and going on runs around Boston.
